rspStmt.AuthEnty: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census.

biblCit.p: U.S. Census Bureau. Census of Services [Computer file]. Washington DC; United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census. Research Data Center [access], Washington DC, 2017

abstract.p: The Census of Service Industries (CSR) is comprised of the following two-digit NAICS sectors: (51) Information (54) Professional Scientific and Technical Services (55) Management of Companies and Enterprises (56) Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services (61) Educational Services (62) Health Care and Social Assistance (71) Arts Entertainment and Recreation (72) Accommodation and Food Services and (81) Other Services (except Public Administration)

Firms in the Economic Census are divided into those sent report forms and those not sent report forms. Establishments sent a report form include large employers i.e. all multi-establishment firms and all single-establishment employer firms with payroll above a specified cutoff as well as a sample of small employers i.e. single-establishment firms with payroll below a specified cutoff in industries for which specialized data precludes reliance solely on administrative records sources. The sample is stratified by industry and geography.

Small employers i.e. single-establishment firms with payroll below a specified cutoff are not selected into the small employer sample. Although the payroll cutoff varies by kind of business small employers not sent a report form generally include firms with less than 10 employees and represent about 10 percent of total revenue of establishments covered in the census. Data on revenue payroll and employment for these small employers were derived or estimated from administrative records of other federal agencies. Some of these firms were sent a shorter version of a report form to obtain industry classification information only.

useStmt.confDec: To obtain this dataset, the user must complete the RDC application process, and be approved for use of this dataset.
useStmt.conditions: Users must (i) successfully apply for RDC access (ii) pass review by agencies (iii) pass security clearance

var.name: itemcode
var.labl: TRAILER DATA ITEM CODE (KEYCODE ON FORM--LEFT PADDED WITH ZEROS TO MAKE 4 CHARAC

var.name: itemvalue_pf
var.labl: 2002 ADDED FLAG--NEED TO FIGURE OUT MEANING, VALUES AS FOR OTHER SOURCE FLAGS (_

var.name: itemvalue_rf
var.labl: FLAG FOR REPORTED VALUE OF TRAILER ITEM--USUALLY R=RESPONSE

var.name: itemvalue_r
var.labl: REPORTED VALUE FOR THIS TRAILER DATA ITEM (0 OFTEN MEANS MISSING)

var.name: itemvalue_f
var.labl: FLAG INDICATING SOURCE OF TRAILER VALUE (R=RESPONSE, ETC)

var.name: itemvalue
var.labl: EDITED VALUE FOR THIS TRAILER DATA ITEM (0 OFTEN MEANS MISSING)

var.name: useflag
var.labl: FLAG FOR WHETHER TRAILER DATA FOR THIS ESTAB IS USABLE (IE USED FOR PUBLICATION)

var.name: optype_xfr
var.labl: TYPE-OF-OPERATION CODE FOR CASES TRANSFERRED TO WHOLESALE

var.name: naics_random
var.labl: RANDOM--CLOSEST IN DATADICT IS NAICSRANDOM, VALUES 0/1

var.name: limupdt
var.labl: LIMUPDT--SEEMS LIKELY RELATED TO LIMADJ (Y/N VAR)

var.name: linenum
var.labl: LINE NUMBER CORRECTION/ADDITION TO LOCATIONS OF OPERATIONS (MAYBE)

var.name: empq1_dcurr12_f
var.labl: SOMETHING TO DO WITH MARCH 12TH EMPLOYMENT, FLAG

var.name: payqtr1_dcurr11_f
var.labl: SOMETHING TO DO WITH 1ST QUARTER PAY, FLAG

var.name: payann_dcurr10_f
var.labl: SOMETHING TO DO WITH ANNUAL PAY, FLAG

var.name: rcpt_dcurr9_f
var.labl: SOMETHING TO DO WITH RECEIPTS, FLAG

var.name: empq1_dcurr12
var.labl: SOMETHING TO DO WITH MARCH 12TH EMPLOYMENT

var.name: payqtr1_dcurr11
var.labl: SOMETHING TO DO WITH 1ST QUARTER PAY

var.name: payann_dcurr10
var.labl: SOMETHING TO DO WITH ANNUAL PAY

var.name: rcpt_dcurr9
var.labl: CORR WITH RCPTOT_R=.999 WHEN NOT ZERO

var.name: id_dcurr8
var.labl: SOME SORT OF IDENTIFIER--ONLY FOR SOME MU'S, SAME FORMAT AS SURVUID

var.name: id_dcurr7
var.labl: SOME SORT OF IDENTIFIER--ONLY FOR SOME MU'S, SAME FORMAT AS SURVUID

var.name: mecs_case
var.labl: IDENTIFIES CASES THAT ARE IN MECS SAMPLE? (MOSTLY TRANSFERRED FROM MANUF)

var.name: impute_type
var.labl: TYPE OF IMPUTATION USED? E.G. MUWARM, AUPDATE, ECUPDATE

var.name: naics_aux_old_xfr
var.labl: NAICS CODE FOR INDUSTRY SERVED (AUXIL ESTAB), PREV CENSUS MANUAL, TRANSFER CASE

var.name: naics_aux_old_xfr_f
var.labl: NAICS CODE FOR INDUSTRY SERVED (AUXIL ESTAB), PREV CENSUS MANUAL, TRANSFER CASE,

var.name: sector_xfr
var.labl: TRADE AREA (SECTOR) TO WHICH TRANSFERRED (USU=2ND CHAR OF TRANSFER_SECTOR)

var.name: naics_aux_a_f
var.labl: AUXIL SCOPE FLAG--INDUSTRY SERVED IN SCOPE FOR EC? ADMIN

var.name: naics_aux_a
var.labl: NAICS CODE FOR INDUSTRY SERVED (AUXIL ESTAB), ADMIN

var.name: bracketed_data
var.labl: FLAG FOR WHETHER DATA WAS BRACKETED

var.name: edit_multipl_trailer
var.labl: RECORD MULTIPLIER FOR TRAILER DATA BASED EDITS

var.name: ecom_any_f
var.labl: DID ESTAB HAVE ANY SALES/RECEIPTS FROM ECOMMERCE? FLAG

var.labl: FIRST QUARTER PAYROLL FOR LEASED EMPLOYEES FLAG

var.name: pay_ann_le_f
var.labl: ANNUAL PAYROLL FOR LEASED EMPLOYEES FLAG

var.labl: RECORD MULTIPLIER FOR INDUSTRY BASED EDITS

var.name: edit_route
var.labl: COMPLEX EDIT ROUTING CODE--INDICATES WHICH EDIT TO PERFORM

var.name: edit_count
var.labl: NUMBER OF TIMES EDIT HAS BEEN PERFORMED

var.name: revenue_a_py
var.labl: REVENUE, TOTAL (IRS FORMS 990--TAX EMPT), PREV YR

var.name: rent_inc_a_py
var.labl: RENTAL INCOME, GROSS (IRS FORMS 1120, 1065), PREV YR

var.name: tax_form_py
var.labl: IRS INCOME TAX FORM FILED, PREV YR

var.name: cost_goodsold_a_py
var.labl: COST OF GOODS SOLD (IRS FORM 990--TAX EXMPT), PREV YR

var.name: tax_form
var.labl: IRS INCOME TAX FORM FILED, CURRENT YR

var.name: cost_goodsold_a
var.labl: COST OF GOODS SOLD (IRS FORM 990--TAX EXMPT)

var.name: naics_old_a
var.labl: NAICS CODE BASED ON NAICS MANUAL FROM PREV CENSUS, ADMIN

var.name: optype_old
var.labl: TYPE-OF-OPERATION CODE, PREV CENSUS NAICS MANUAL

var.name: response_batch
var.labl: SERIALIZED BATCH NUMBER ASSIGNED FOR DATA CAPTURED

var.name: refer_f
var.labl: INDICATES WHETHER OR NOT REFERRAL EXISTS

var.name: limadj
var.labl: EXPANSION FACTOR FOR I & T EDIT/PLAIN VANILLA EDIT LIMIT ADJUSTMENT

var.name: priority
var.labl: PRIORITY--MEANING NOT CLEAR, VALUE B/1-6, 6 MOST COMMON

var.name: optype_mult
var.labl: MULTIPLE TYPES OF OPERATIONS CHECKED ON FORM

var.name: load_date
var.labl: DATE SURVEY UNIT WAS LOADED INTO DATABASE FROM RESPONSE BUCKET (SAS DATE/TIME VA

var.name: lrgstore_fac
var.labl: LARGE STORE FACTOR (IMPLIED DECIMAL LOOKS LIKE IT CHANGES, BUT NOT CLEAR)

var.name: edit_batch
var.labl: BATCH NUMBER ASSIGNED TO THE REPORT FORM FOR FORMAT/COMPLEX EDITING.

var.name: satisfied_date
var.labl: DATE THAT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS WERE SATISFIED (SAS DATE/TIME VALUE)

var.name: remail_flag
var.labl: FLAG INDICATING WHETHER OR NOT REMAILED FORM

var.name: exten_date
var.labl: EXTENSION DATE? BUT DATES LOOK AWFULLY EARLY FOR THAT (SAS DATE/TIME VALUE)

var.name: zip_match
var.labl: MATCH ZIP--USUALLY MATCHES ZIP5, BUT NOT ALWAYS

var.name: state_postal
var.labl: STATE, 2 CHARACTER POSTAL ABBREVIATION (DIFFERS SOME FROM TABULATED)

var.name: tie_break
var.labl: TIEBRK=GEO TIE BREAK (GTB)? BUT CODING DOESN'T MATCH

var.name: geo_conf_a
var.labl: LEVEL OF CONFIDENCE IN BR GEOCODES

var.name: place_cen_a
var.labl: PLACE CODES FROM BR (CENSUS, NOT FIPS)

var.name: md
var.labl: MD--ABOUT 30 5 DIGIT CODES THAT ALL END IN 4 (EXC 00000 AND 99999)

var.name: naics_bridge_sector
var.labl: NAICS SECTOR BASED ON BRIDGE CODE

var.name: form_edit

var.name: batchseq
var.labl: SEQUENCE NUMBER WITHIN DATA ENTRY BATCH

var.name: num_line

var.labl: PERCENT OF SALES/RECEIPTS/REVENUES FROM THIS LINE CODE

var.name: firmid

var.labl: INDICATES WHETHER OR NOT THE SURV UNIT IS ACTIVE
